key_points: Gabby Petito was remembered in a memorial service in New York one week after her body was found in Wyoming.
Joseph Petito, Gabby's father, and Jim Schmidt, her stepfather, both spoke movingly at the service about their love and memories of her.
The Petito family used an empty urn at the memorial service as the FBI has not released Gabby's body to them.
Joseph Petito shared a message of living fully and leaving unhealthy relationships.
Mourners, including Corissa Ambrose who knew Gabby, praised her free-spirited and kind-hearted nature.
The Petito family requests donations to the Gabby Petito Foundation instead of flowers, aimed at helping bring missing children home.
Gabby Petito was reported missing over two weeks before her memorial, and her death has been ruled a homicide.
A vigil was also held in North Port, with around 200 people honoring Gabby's life.
Gabby Petito's fiancé, Brian, is considered a person of interest in her death, with a federal arrest warrant issued for him.
Gabby's remains were discovered in the Bridger-Teton National Forest, her last social media post was on August 25.
